reviews.review_msg: Materials aren't that hard but he makes things so much harder by using very unreasonable teaching method. Assignments instructions are confusing as hell but he expects students to answer them perfectly just in 200-300 words.
Georgi's lecture notes are pretty straightforward.  Write everything down and do the tutorial assignments, and it all makes sense.  The written assignments take a long time, but this is a W class.
do not take his course, unfair to grade assignments!!
ECON 355 W is hard. The class average is super low.
not the sharpest knife in the drawer
excellent professor.

the class is a breeze i never showed up and ended up with a B+, the exams are fair the final was a bit more challenging than the midterm but not impossible. The only bad thing about the class was the TA favoured some students over others and this was a bit annoying but the class was interesting and easy and Alex was a clear prof
Nice guy, and a pretty easy class.  Easy to ace assignments, midterm was kind of hard but final was easier.  The prof overall has a good attitude.
Nice prof, hard TA. He sometimes repeat himself but he just want to make sure we understand the material. Fair midterm, harder final
Great! Ghosh is very nice and approachable. His lectures were clear and organized. Exams were very fair. Overall just great prof. Very recommended.
He's very nice
He interacts with the class quite often and is helpful during office hours.  Also, very approachable.

He is a really good prof. Always willing to help and actually cares about his students.  He explains really well in lectures.  If you attend lectures and keep up with the notes, you will definitely do well in his class. I highly recommend him.
First day of class, 156 students, 3rd week of class 46... you decide...

This was the one econ class that I was most looking forward to taking and I was utterly disappointed.  When he was actually interested, the prof seemed more interested in getting laughs than helping students learn.  Further, a quarter of the lectures were taken up by student presentations which is not what I expect my tuition money to go towards.

i think he dreaded the 3 hour lectures as much as we did. spoke in a monotone and read right off the slides so i stopped showing up after lecture 3. tests are fairly easy and fair though cuz i think the TA's did the marking. this class has potential to be so interesting and i think he killed it

Akbar can be rude and mean sometimes. But he is a great prof. Very clear on what he is teaching. just go to the lecture every time, pay more attention on what he is saying, its a easy A. He gives very easy exams and always wants his students to do well in his class. He is helpful and nice during office hrs, too!
The greatest prof ever.
Good prof!
no empathy, marks are distributed like they blindfolded themselves and threw darts on a wall. avoid him. my nightmares include him and this lecture

Grading is a mess. Makes fun of you when you ask questions during class and doesn't give you helpful feedback. My friend wrote an essay 4 hrs before due and got 100% while another friend of mine worked on the essay for 2 weeks and got 70%. High discrimination. Do not take his classes. You will fail if you get 70% or less.

I understand why many students love him but he grades assignments and exams with a "pass/fail" mindset and because of that the curve of the course gives you a C when your overall average is 84%. I got a D because I got 71% and lost my financial help from the school. I contacted him about this but he didn't care. FIND ANOTHER PROF!

Exams are easy but lectures are tedious. Maybe 40% of the lecture material Will actually show up on the exam. For 355, just remember the basic diagrams for all models and the basic concepts discussed in class. The math that you deread will never be needed. There is too much math to remember anyway.
Nice Prof but NOT ENOUGH TIME for the exam. (or too long exam in a short period)

Just becareful not to get too cocky with this class. It's totally possible to to get 100% leading up to the final exam however due to the nature of downward scaling and the easiness of the class, you'll probably end up with a C to a B if you walked in with a perfect mark. I personally didn't enjoy myself too much here.
Nice prof.  He likes to ask students to sit right in front him especially when they come in late. Easy to get high grade.
I'm in my final year and he is easily the best teacher I've had.
he deserves a :)
one of the best, most interesting, humorous econ prof.

He is a really good teacher. His teaching style is more holistic than most SFU course. You learn a great deal that is directly applicable to the real world economy. Lectures were always interesting, we even have class debates. Final was long and you can't memorize for the final, you got to understand the economy condition (past/current).

His lectures are pretty interesting because he uses a lot of examples. However..he tends to go off topic. But overall, his exams are pretty easy...just as long as you follow the hints that he gives out during lectures.
A professor with an excellent sense of humour and a pleasant demeanor.  He enjoys speaking with his students and goes to great lengths to explain the material.
No Comments
to be fair, the prof. is pretty good, but hard exam~ also, bad TA - Bryan Yu
interesting and funny but don't caught eating or sleeping
to be fair, his exam is not that hard, but i have to say that the multiple chioce part is tooooo tricky, and the time for exam is not enough. though the class is fun, however, not very useful.
No Comments
One of the best profs in econ. Great story teller, and is extremely knowledgable. Very funny guy who swears quite a bit.
Very good class, highly knowledgable prof, entertaining, easy exams, what more could you ask for?  Listen when he mumbles.. that is what is on the exams.  Easy A
Absolutely the worse professor at SFU.  Beware, he takes pictures of his students during lecture...
Zzzzz~~~

He's the worse prof that i've ever had.  He constantly mumbles when he's talking about important points that he will put on a test.  When I went to see him, he was no clearer.  His graphs are unclear.
Great Stories, most entertaining econ prof ever.  And he wears the sunglasses cause he's got a medical condition with his eyes, but hard to figure out what he wants on the exams, just study it all!

Very enjoyable class... keep up in the reading and pay attention to his main topics... very enjoyable lectures... but it's up to you to get the point out of it. If he offers extra ciricular activities take them... they're great opportunities! good course
He takes the class outside of economics to look at the big picture, which I found to be great
Lazy prof who always wear old-fashioned sunglasses to classes. His lectures were boring and I didn't learn much from this course~ As a recommendation, DON T take econ 355 with him!
haha..why would someone wear sun glasses in lecture hall?
No Comments
Funny lectures....try to get an easy TA cause Devoretz doesn't mark anything.
The most unorganized prof i know, he expects you to know things he doesn't teach
haha entertaining lectures
Lectures are a hell-of-a-lotta fun! Funny anecdotes keep lectures interesting
She really cares about her students and encourages you to do well. Approachable.
